page.title: 09Ashwood Marina
page.content: Ashwood Marina is built on an arm of the Staffordshire and Worcester Canal. It was originally an old coal wharf, where coal was transferred from the Kingswinford Railway to the canal narrowboats. The railway was built in 1827 and was the first standard guage railway in the Black Country. It ran from Baggeridge Colliery to the Ashwood Basin and was the only line always in private ownership.The locomotive,the Agenoria,is now in the York Railway Museum.The Marina act as brokers for the sail of boats and also provide berths.Boats which are sold through the Marina are automatically entitled to a berth but there is a two year waiting list for other boats.There are 160 boats there at the moment but there are plans to expand it to 200 berths. The Marina is very pretty and peaceful and very well run.
